creditline: Gift of John and Ida Davies
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e), ink and color on paper
portfolio: One Hundred Famous Views of Edo (Meisho Edo hyakkei 名所江戸百景)
text: One Hundred Famous Views of Edo is from the last great landscape series designed by Utagawa Hiroshige. This print was the thirty-first in the series and depicts the cherry-tree lined approach to Azuma Shrine, in what is now eastern Tokyo. The shrine is known for a tree with a split trunk, the titular “entwined camphor, ” which can be seen on the shrine’s grounds.
title: Azuma Shrine and the Entwined Camphor
